title: How the TikTok deal could tighten Trump’s cultural grip
content: As Trump-friendly billionaires take control of TikTok’s U.S. operation, some see the beginnings of a "cultural vibe shift" on the platform — and an echo of changes taking place across the U.S. media landscape.
creator: Brendan Bordelon, Katherine Long, Gabby Miller, Cheyenne Haslett

title: Canada could be the next nation to ban social media for kids
content: The Liberal government is considering a ban for kids under 14 as it drafts online harm legislation.
creator: Mickey Djuric

title: Merz, Meloni rally behind disinfo-fighting center that Trump thinks is ‘wasteful’
content: German and Italian leaders want to hold the line against Russia's hybrid threats.
creator: Sam Clark

title: Document reveals EU-US pitch for $800B postwar Ukraine ‘prosperity’ plan
content: The proposal hinges on a ceasefire that remains elusive while Russian leader Vladimir Putin persists with his full-scale invasion.
creator: Sarah Wheaton, Gerardo Fortuna, Kathryn Carlson, Gregorio Sorgi

title: Grok could have produced 3 million sexual deepfakes in 11 days, says estimate
content: European regulators have yet to decide how to handle the explosion of nonconsensual deepfakes on the platform.
creator: Eliza Gkritsi

title: TikTok lands $14B deal to avoid US ban
content: The new owners will include Oracle, a tech giant co-founded by Trump ally Larry Ellison.
creator: Katherine Long

title: Ursula von der Leyen’s trade troubles are just beginning
content: Despite notching up wins abroad, the European Commission has hit a wall with EU countries and lawmakers.
creator: Camille Gijs

title: EU Parliament backs Thierry Breton in free speech spat with Washington
content: U.S. visa ban sets "a dangerous precedent" for the EU, lawmakers warn.
creator: Seb Starcevic

title: Court rules TikTok Canada can continue to operate — for now
content: Federal judge quashes government order that would have shuttered the company’s Canadian business offices.
creator: Mickey Djuric

title: Too American? Brussels’ embrace of US corporate jargon sparks language row
content: Ursula von der Leyen’s Davos cheerleading for U.S. corporate terms gets the side eye from lovers of Latin.
creator: Jacob Parry

title: Former EU tech czar Thierry Breton doesn’t hate the US — even though it sanctioned him
content: Travel bans targeting individual EU officials are "unjustified" and should be "corrected," Breton told POLITICO.
creator: Nicholas Vinocur

title: Ryanair’s Michael O’Leary wants you to know he’s sick of Donald Trump and Elon Musk
content: Meet the Irish corporate titan who's actually willing to call the U.S. president a "liar" and the world's richest man an "idiot."
creator: Tommaso Lecca

title: Beijing pledges to defend tech crown jewels against EU cyber rules
content: China will take “necessary measures” to protect Huawei and others if the EU imposes new supply chain restrictions, foreign ministry said.
creator: Sam Clark

title: Berlin weighs digital tax in response to Trump tariff threats
content: Calls grow in Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s coalition and conservative bloc to target Big Tech.
creator: Frida Preuß, Jasper Bennink, Jürgen Klöckner

title: The EU’s magical, mystery trade weapon — and other options to nail Trump
content: POLITICO analyzes the actions that European leaders can consider when they gather for an emergency summit this week.
creator: Koen Verhelst, Carlo Martuscelli

title: EU looks to ban nudification apps following Grok outrage
content: The proliferation of intimate deepfakes on X has raised questions over the bloc’s AI law.
creator: Pieter Haeck

title: Brussels plans to force governments to block Huawei from 5G
content: New EU cyber bill looks to root out risky Chinese technology vendors from tech supply chains across Europe.
creator: Sam Clark

title: US pressure revives call for powerful EU tech regulator
content: Europe's maze of rules and regulators is in sharp focus as Brussels grapples with X's AI tool Grok.
creator: Pieter Haeck

title: EU should ban AI nudification apps in wake of Grok scandal, say lawmakers
content: 57 MEPs say Brussels is not doing enough in response to naked deepfakes on X.
creator: Pieter Haeck

title: It’s not over, Europe’s regulators tell X
content: Grok users can still generate sexualized images despite fresh promises from X.
creator: Eliza Gkritsi

title: China’s Shein meets EU officials in Brussels after avoiding suspension in France
content: BRUSSELS — For a company that got caught  selling weapons and child-like sex dolls  on the European market, Shein’s access to EU decision-makers is remarkably steady. After fending off a legal challenge to its online platform in France last month, the Chinese ultrafast fashion brand is now in the European Union’s capital persuading the European Commission it’s a good environmental citizen. And Brussels is listening. Shein’s Executive Chairman Donald Tang met with ...
creator: Marianne Gros, Klara Durand

title: Elon Musk denies Grok generates illegal content
content: BRUSSELS — Elon Musk has denied that X’s artificial intelligence tool Grok generates illegal content in the wake of AI-generated undressed and sexualized images on the platform. In a fresh post Wednesday, X’s powerful owner sought to argue that users — not the AI tool — are responsible and that the platform is fully compliant with all laws. “I[‘m] not aware of any naked underage images generated by Grok,” he said. “Literally zero.” “When asked to generate images, [G...
creator: Pieter Haeck, Eliza Gkritsi

title: Ukraine’s tech prodigy becomes new minister of defense
content: KYIV — Ukraine’s new defense minister, Mykhailo Fedorov, appointed by parliament on Wednesday, is promising to bring his tech experience to the job by enhancing the military’s cutting-edge drone program and pledging deep reforms. “It is impossible to fight with new technologies while relying on an old organizational structure,” Fedorov said in a statement on Wednesday. Fedorov, 34, is a tech prodigy who entered Ukrainian politics at 28 and  served as the first deputy prime...
creator: Veronika Melkozerova

title: Shein to appear before EU Parliament
content: Ultra-fast-fashion giant Shein will attend a hearing at the European Parliament to discuss the company’s business practices. Pressure has been mounting on Shein to meet with policymakers, who are concerned about the influx of cheap parcels it generates as well as suspected breaches of EU law and the environmental impact it has, especially as the company was caught selling child-like sex dolls in France . The Parliament’s internal market committee had been trying for weeks to bring th...
creator: Eliza Gkritsi, Max Griera, Mathieu Pollet

title: UK nudification app ban won’t apply to Elon Musk’s Grok
content: LONDON — The U.K. government’s upcoming ban on nudification apps won’t apply to general-purpose AI tools like Elon Musk’s Grok, according to Tech Secretary Liz Kendall. The ban will “apply to applications that have one despicable purpose only: to use generative AI to turn images of real people into fake nude pictures and videos without their permission,” Kendall said in a letter to Science, Innovation and Technology committee chair Chi Onwurah published Wednesday. Grok, which i...
creator: Mizy Clifton

title: Poland faces millions in EU fines as president vetoes tech bill
content: A clash between Poland’s right-wing president and its centrist ruling coalition over the European Union’s flagship social media law is putting the country further at risk of multimillion euro fines from Brussels. President Karol Nawrocki is holding up a bill that would implement the EU’s Digital Services Act, a tech law that allows regulators to police how social media firms moderate content. Nawrocki, an ally of U.S. President Donald Trump, said in a statement that the law wou...
creator: Eliza Gkritsi

title: Inside Denmark’s struggle to break up with Silicon Valley
content: COPENHAGEN — For Denmark’s media, it’s the last stand. As news publications across Europe signed licensing deals with U.S. tech giants like Meta and Google to keep traffic flowing, the Danish press has emerged as an outlier among its European peers. Instead of cutting individual deals, the country’s publishers formed a common front, demanding a higher price for the use of their content in online products from search to AI chatbots. But with Danish media in deepening financial difficulty and shed...
creator: Jacob Parry

title: US State Department threatens UK over probe into Elon Musk’s X
content: LONDON — The U.S. Department of State’s Sarah B. Rogers says “nothing is off the table” if the U.K. government makes good on its threat to ban Elon Musk’s X over concerns about a deluge of AI-generated sexualized deepfakes on the platform. “I would say from America’s perspective … nothing is off the table when it comes to free speech,” Rogers, the under secretary of state for public diplomacy, told GB News in an interview which aired in the U.K. in the early hours of Tues...
creator: Mizy Clifton

title: Fix Grok or else, EU tech chief tells Elon Musk’s X
content: BRUSSELS — The European Commission’s top tech official has warned Elon Musk’s X to quickly “fix” its AI tool Grok — or face consequences under the controversial Digital Services Act. The fact that Grok allows users to generate pictures that depict women and minors undressed and sexualized is “horrendous”, said Henna Virkkunen, the Commission’s tech chief. She urged the company to take immediate action. “X now has to fix its AI tool in the EU, and t...
creator: Pieter Haeck

title: Will the UK actually ban Elon Musk’s X?
content: LONDON — U.K. ministers are warning Elon Musk’s X it faces a ban if it doesn’t get its act together. But outlawing the social media platform is easier said than done. The U.K.’s communications regulator Ofcom on Monday launched a formal investigation into a deluge of non-consensual sexualized deepfakes produced by X’s AI chatbot Grok amid growing calls for action from U.K. politicians. It will determine whether the creation and distribution of deepfakes on ...
creator: Mizy Clifton

title: Meta taps former Trump adviser to be president, vice chair
content: Meta named former Trump adviser Dina Powell McCormick to serve as president and vice chair Monday, further cementing the company’s growing ties to Republicans and President Donald Trump’s White House. In addition to a long career on Wall Street, Powell McCormick served as Trump’s deputy national security adviser during his first term. She was also a member of the George W. Bush administration. She first  joined Meta’s board last April , part of a broader play by the social media and artific...
creator: Brendan Bordelon
